page.title: 13GLOSSOPDALE EMPLOYMENT (2)
page.content: {The need}for people to{travel out of {the valley to work}is reflected in the frequent train service to Manchester (trains every 15 minutes) and the volume of the road traffic. In a one hour{tally count}beginning at{7.30am on a typical weekday morning on the busiest route{1,014 vehicles}left the valley:-843 cars,9 buses,4 coaches,33 motorcycles and 4 cycles, and 61 vans and 41 heavy trucks. {The closure of a local textile mill, John Waltons, in 1985 with the{loss of {283 jobs}highlights this problem. Although opportunities will be offered to the workers in other factories from the same group it will{cost almost the {equivalent of one week's wage}in each month in travel expenses. Many people didn't agree with the closure. There was a march from the factory to Norfolk Sq. on{6th.March'85}in protest
